info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 2:32PM EDT until May 23 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Palm Beach.
* WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 232 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Palm Beach, Wellington, Lake Worth, Greenacres, Royal Palm Beach, Palm Springs, Haverhill, Cloud Lake, Lake Belvedere Estates, Royal Palm Estates, Gun Club Estates, Golden Lakes, Palm Beach International Airport, Schall Circle, Lake Clarke Shores, Glen Ridge, Stacey Street, Plantation Mobile Home Park, Century Village and Westgate- Belvedere Homes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
